DataElement.preferredName: Testicular Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Pathologic Distant Metastasis M Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for the testicular carcinoma based on evidence obtained from pathologic examination through completion of definitive surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor Pathologic M Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._One criteria of the TNM staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the testis. It predominantly affects young men. Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CRF standard harmonization. mc 1/31/17

ValueDomain.preferredName: Testicular Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 7 Pathologic M Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of testicular cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v7 classification system as they pertain to distant metastases.  There is no pathologic M0 for testicular cancer. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)_A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pM1 TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pM1 TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pM1 TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with distant metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pM1a TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pM1a TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with non-regional nodal or pulmonary metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pM1a TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with non-regional nodal or pulmonary metastasis. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Testicular Cancer pM1b TNM Finding v7

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Testicular Cancer pM1b TNM Finding v7
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Testicular cancer with metastasis other than to non-regional lymph nodes and lung. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Testicular Cancer pM1b TNM Finding v7
Concepts.definition: Testicular cancer with metastasis other than to non-regional lymph nodes and lung. (from AJCC 7th Ed.)
